Geography.name: Silk Road Secrets
Geography.description: Journey through history and geography as you uncover the mysteries of ancient trade routes. This quiz explores the lands and cultures connected by the Silk Road, testing your knowledge of historical locations and cultural landmarks.

questions.text: What part of the world was once known as Cathay?
People are supposed to drive on the left-hand side of the road in which country?
Where is the Louvre museum?

Geography.name: Global Trivia Challenge
Geography.description: Test your knowledge of countries, cultures, and landmarks from around the globe. This quiz covers a wide range of geographical facts, from continents to capitals, and everything in between.

questions.text: Which of these countries is not in Europe?
According to legend, in what country are you most likely to meet a leprechaun?
In what U.S. city can you find the Basketball Hall of Fame?
What is the capital of New Zealand?
What city's airport uses the code ORD?

Geography.name: Land of the Rising Sun
Geography.description: Explore the unique geography and culture of Japan. This quiz delves into the islands, cities, and traditions that define this fascinating nation.

questions.text: In what country did Pokemon originate?
Into what body of water does the Rhone River flow?
In what city would you find people studying art and design at the Fashion Institute of Technology?

Geography.name: American Landmarks & Lore
Geography.description: Discover the iconic places and cultural touchstones of the United States. This quiz explores everything from chocolate squares to Girl Scout troops, testing your knowledge of American geography and history.

questions.text: Where is Ghirardelli Square located?

In what city is TV's 'The Mary Tyler Moore Show' set?

Geography.name: Global Oddities & Facts
Geography.description: Uncover some of the world's most unusual and intriguing geographical facts. From police nicknames to oil spills, this quiz explores the unexpected corners of our planet.

questions.text: In what country are police officers referred to as 'bobbies'?
